alert.note: Alert for Knox (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 11:35AM CDT until July 20 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Anderson, Blount, Knox, Loudon, Meigs, Monroe, Morgan, Rhea and Roane. * WHEN...Until 145 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1234 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain still falling due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible over the area for the next hour. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oak Ridge, Maryville, Lenoir City, Kingston, Sweetwater, Rockwood, Loudon, Farragut, Fairview, Oliver Springs, Midtown, Harriman, Vonore, Greenback, Friendsville, Philadelphia, Bradbury, Paint Rock, Dearmond and Tellico Village. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
